page.title: 17INVERURIE BY-PASS
page.content:
For many years a by-pass for Inverurie has been talked about. The town lies on the main route from Aberdeen to Inverness. This means that many vehicles are driven through the town at all times of the day and night. The streets in the burgh were not built for such traffic and at busy times a line of traffic stretches through the town causing traffic jams. Heavy lorries annoy the inhabitants.
A number of factors have led to the delay in the construction of the by-pass. Recently this has been due to people objecting to the route of the by-pass. However, at last it seems that the new route will soon be built. It is hoped to commence work in April, 1987. The estimated cost is 6.2 million pounds and it will be 5 miles long.
